stories.title: Five Secrets of the Adama Programming Language

stories.text:
For example this one: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=29289875

I would think that if this is such a hot topic that many people are trying to address but does not fit well for HN, then it would only benefit to explain why it is so instead of keeping people in dark.

Besides I find many removed articles are talking about issues with the social media which relates to tech industry in general.
stories.title: Why HN is removing articles that ask about HN policy?

stories.text: I was taking vacation from HN for a few weeks and some time ago I came back. I noticed the little triangles next to submission are gone, same for comments. Is this feature removed or something else happened that I'm not aware of (i.e. karma levels required for voting got higher). I googled for the answers but could not find explanation.
stories.title: Ask HN: Is Voting Turned Off?
